result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D White

records.addlTxt: Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    CHRISTIN MARIE SAINT PIERRE   $1,021.00

Defendant Michael D White not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Michael D White.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant not produced; defense requested plea and sentencing adjournment. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Correspondence with parties. Dodge Correctional informs court that their facility is unavailable for zoom appearances during scheduled timeslot previously selected for 09/21/2022. Parties stipulate to having the defendant appear IN-PERSON. Case remains calendared as previously set for 09/21/2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Michael D White not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they recently received additional discovery, however he believes that they will be in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing date to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Michael D White not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the state, but need additional time to review with client. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

RESCHEDULED WITH APPROVAL OF JUDGE GRAYSON. 

Case is rescheduled to 8:30 AM via zoom on 06/02/2022. Parties notified. Case adjourned in Branch 16.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Michael D White not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the state. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Michael D White in court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw; both appear by video.  Defendant Michael D White in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Verrault. Court took judicial notice of 19CF3925. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney William Hotchkiss on behalf of Attorney Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Michael D White not in court, in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. States witness was present. Attorney Rakestraw is in trial in another court on another matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Michael D White in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Michael D White in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
